titleStmt.title: Sixe demaunds (from an vnlearned Protestant, to a learned Papist,) so forcible against all obstinate Papists, that not any of them are able to reply, without absurd equiuocation. Also an inuincible argument, to proue the Church of Rome to erre, with an infallible note whereby to know the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

Sixe demaunds (from an vnlearned Protestant, to a learned Papist,) so forcible against all obstinate Papists, that not any of them are able to reply, without absurd equiuocation. Also an inuincible argument, to proue the Church of Rome to erre, with an infallible note whereby to know the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Simon Stafford, dwelling in the Cloth-fayre, neere the signe of the Red Lion,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: Sixe demaunds to the learned Papists.
Caption title (page 27) reads: An infallible note, whereby to know the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
